bug.author: turian
bug.summary: trainer.test() should return the test score
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
trainer.test() has no return value. However, after testing one might like to have the test score returned, and saved. <denchmark-h:h4>Code sample</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>test_score = trainer.test() </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h3>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
trainer.test() should return the final test score. <denchmark-h:h3>Environment</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>* CUDA: - GPU: - available: False - version: None * Packages: - numpy: 1.18.5 - pyTorch_debug: False - pyTorch_version: 1.5.0 - pytorch-lightning: 0.7.6 - tensorboard: 2.2.2 - tqdm: 4.46.1 * System: - OS: Darwin - architecture: - 64bit - - processor: i386 - python: 3.7.7 - version: Darwin Kernel Version 18.7.0: Tue Aug 20 16:57:14 PDT 2019; root:xnu-4903.271.2~2/RELEASE_X86_64 </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h3>Additional context</denchmark-h>
Althought in some settings, test is only done immediately before publication and thus should not be used for model selection, there are other settings where validation is used for early stopping and test is used for final held-out evaluation. In these settings, being able to save the test score is important.

comments.comment: In addition to scores, it could also be predictions when we don't have the test set label (e.g. GLUE). Ideally we can get access to the return value of test_epoch_end.
This now works in 0.8.5. Trainer.test() returns whatever you return in test_epoch_end.
